text:
It’s been truly moving to witness the countless number of people from across the country come together to honor the life and legacy of Charlie Kirk. Charlie was more than a devoted husband, father, and Conservative activist. He was, above all, a man of deep Christian faith with comprehensive knowledge of the Scripture. He dedicated his life to spreading the message of Christ and empowering the next generation to think for themselves and stand up for their beliefs.

Charlie ignited a movement, inspiring countless young Americans to engage and get involved. That legacy was on full display during Sunday’s powerful memorial in Arizona with people traveling from across the nation to pay their respects and listen to the tributes from Charlie’s pastor, Vice President J.D. Vance, President Trump, and Charlie’s widow, Erika Kirk. Erika’s words, especially her forgiveness of the man who took her husband’s life, were a profound testament to her strength grounded in unshakable faith. Erika will do a great job carrying on Charlie’s mission at Turning Point USA.

Thank you to everyone who has shared kind words and memories of Charlie. His legacy and influence will continue to grow with each passing day.

This morning, I led a bipartisan roundtable with my colleagues on the Highways and Transit Subcommittee along with transit leaders & law enforcement from around the country to discuss deterring transit crime. This fall, the T&I Committee will work to craft a Surface Transportation Reauthorization bill to improve and fund our roads, bridges, and public transit— improving safety on public transit is an important part of that equation.

The tragic stabbing of Iryna Zarutska in Charlotte underscores the urgent need for transit safety reforms. My Subcommittee’s roundtable was a crucial step toward ensuring our public transportation systems are safe for all Americans. Read more below! 
https://t.co/pipl4YIvhG

Today we honor the foundation of our great nation, the Constitution! It’s the cornerstone of our freedoms, limited government, and rule of law. I’m proud to serve and protect these principles! https://t.co/WzjTK2CSCQ

Today is National App Challenge Day! I'm proud to support the Congressional App Challenge, which gives middle & high school students across NC-07 a chance to showcase their creativity and coding skills!

Details below! https://t.co/Tu0JBlWFcp

The destruction of the memorial honoring Charlie Kirk in Wilmington is deeply disappointing. Charlie was a true conservative voice who inspired countless Americans, and this act of vandalism disrespects his legacy. In moments like this, it's important we come together to uphold our shared values and continue the respectful dialogue which Charlie championed.

My district offices are still holding an American flag recycling drive. Just as there's etiquette for displaying your flag, there's also etiquette for disposing of flags. If you bring your American flag to one of my offices listed below, we will properly dispose of it in a respectful manner.

What an incredible gathering in Wilmington tonight to honor and remember the life of Charlie Kirk. While I wasn’t able to attend due to votes in Washington, I was grateful to join a moving tribute led by Speaker Johnson in the Capitol this evening. It’s truly inspiring to see people from across the country coming together to honor Charlie’s life and legacy.

Today, we pause and remember the nearly 3,000 lives lost on September 11, 2001. We honor the bravery of our first responders, firefighters, police and all who ran towards danger. Never forget. https://t.co/6eErM6XHim

A significant milestone was reached this afternoon as my legislation to grant full federal recognition to the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina was passed as part of the House FY26 National Defense Authorization Act. This marks an important step forward in securing the rights and benefits the Lumbee people have long been denied. I look forward to the Senate’s consideration.

Watch my full remarks on the Lumbee Tribe below.

My heartfelt prayers are with Charlie Kirk’s wife, children, and loved ones. He was a courageous voice for faith, freedom, and conservative values. His legacy will live on, and he will be deeply missed. https://t.co/QMEdHTioaY
Please pray for Charlie Kirk and his young family.

Thank you, Secretary Duffy, for bringing attention to the tragic and deeply troubling stabbing in Charlotte. This horrific act underscores a larger problem, when dangerous individuals are enabled by weak, soft-on-crime policies public safety suffers. No one should feel unsafe riding public transportation funded by their own tax dollars. As a member of the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, I will continue working with Secretary Duffy to restore law and order in our communities, especially on public transit.

Great to sit down with local blueberry growers in Elizabethtown for a productive roundtable. Agriculture is the backbone of NC-07, and I'm committed to supporting our farmers and ensuring their voices are heard in Washington! https://t.co/TiCaGUcgjT

While back in the district, I met with my Agriculture Advisory Council. We discussed the Working Families Tax Cut, Farm Bill 2.0, and agriculture labor. I’m proud of the work Republicans in Congress are doing for the ag industry back home! https://t.co/Pz2UfRTbM2

Had an insightful tour of Mann+Hummel Purolator Filters in Fayetteville! Proud to see world-class manufacturing and innovation happening right here in NC-07. Grateful for their role in creating jobs and driving our local economy forward.

I spoke at the Fayetteville Chamber State of the Community on how the Working Families Tax Cut is protecting all Americans from the largest tax hike in history, keeping more money in Americans’ pockets, bolstering our domestic investment in manufacturing, and strengthening our national security. I always enjoy bringing updates and good news back to NC-07!

Proud to support the bipartisan FEMA Act of 2025, which includes several of my own legislative provisions, because disaster relief should be fast, fair, and focused on results — not buried in red tape. This bill cuts bureaucracy, speeds recovery, and puts survivors first. Listen to my full remarks from today’s Transportation and Infrastructure hearing below.

Met with Cape Fear Valley Health System and toured their medical center in Fayetteville last week! CFVH and Methodist University are working hard to bring the first medical school to Fayetteville in 2026! https://t.co/zHP3wPCchm

Wishing the hardworking folks of NC-07 a safe and restful Labor Day! Today we honor the grit, determination, and dignity of America’s workers. Your contributions power our communities and our country! https://t.co/8B4U2T1xBL

This week I toured the Fayetteville Bus Station, a crucial hub for Greyhound Bus Lines and Flix North America. Partnerships between Greyhound, the Fayetteville Area System of Transit, and NCDOT ensure our communities remain connected and transit remains accessible for all North Carolinians.

Proud to bring together state, local, and federal leaders in Wilmington for a roundtable & press conference on the upcoming surface transportation reauthorization. Teamwork across all levels of government is how we build safer, stronger infrastructure for the future. https://t.co/VSnDQ6lsDK

This district work period I’ve gotten to tour some of the great small businesses in NC-07, like Koppers Inc. in Leland, a key player in wood treatment and infrastructure support. Proud to see innovation and good jobs right here in our community! https://t.co/AqYsyEAJwc

Had an insightful visit to CSX Davis Yard in Leland recently. Freight rail plays a vital role in keeping NC-07 and the entire country connected and competitive. As Chairman of the Highways & Transit Subcommittee, I’m committed to investing in the infrastructure—both on roads and rails—which powers our economy.

As Hurricane Erin moves offshore, NC-07 will be seeing dangerous rip currents and rough surf this week. Please stay out of the water, follow local alerts, and put safety first! https://t.co/CZcZq2ESpx

It was great to tour Raglan Defense Technology and see firsthand how their cutting-edge work supports our national defense. In NC-07, they’re building the advanced systems which help keep our service members safe and our country secure. Manufacturing like this is not only the backbone of our economy, but it’s also vital to our defense readiness.

The One Big Beautiful Bill brings real wins for NC agriculture! More resources for our farmers, stronger rural economies, and protection for the land that feeds America. Check out some of the stats below! https://t.co/O6kCOcPBos

An inspiring group of men and women joined VA Secretary Collins, Congressman Hudson and I at the Fayetteville VA Medical Center to discuss how we can partner together to improve care for our nations veterans. There’s a lot of work ahead, but I’m eager to partner with an administration which shares my same commitment to our nation’s heroes.

https://t.co/qnI551W15H

I proudly co-introduced the Save Our Bacon Act with Congresswoman Hinson. North Carolina is a national leader in pork production, and this bill ensures the men and women behind that success are not burdened by another state’s regulations. I’m committed to standing up for our hardworking farmers and ensuring their voices are heard in Washington.
Promises made, promises kept!

Congratulations to Congressman Mike Flood on becoming chairman! Congressman Dusty Johnson was a great leader for many years, and I know Mike will continue to build upon his successes and grow the caucus!

Two years ago today, July 23, 2023, Dr. Gubad Ibadoghlu was unjustly imprisoned in Azerbaijan. His freedom is still being denied. I strongly condemn his politically motivated detention and stand with all those fighting for his release.

My bipartisan resolution, H.Res. 120, calls for his immediate and unconditional release and I’ve personally urged Secretary Rubio to stay resolute in this effort. The support from my colleagues makes clear: the U.S. will not stay silent - we will keep working until Dr. Ibadoghlu is free.

I was proud to welcome the Corn Growers Association of North Carolina to Washington! As a member of the House Agriculture Committee, I value their insights on the challenges and opportunities facing corn producers in our state. These are the folks feeding our communities and fueling our economy, and their voice is critical in shaping smart, effective farm policy!

This morning, I caught up with USDOT Secretary Sean Duffy and House T&I Chairman Sam Graves before speaking to industry leaders at the Surface Reauthorization event at the DOT’s office in D.C. It's great to hear Secretary Duffy's goals align with Committee’s, as we work together for safer, more efficient, and innovative transportation and infrastructure in the 119th Congress.
Thank you, President Trump, for taking action to make our communities safe again!

Thank you, Secretary Duffy, for joining us at today’s Transportation and Infrastructure Committee hearing. It was valuable to hear a firsthand update on the important work you’re doing and how Congress can assist.

Listen to our exchange during the hearing below. https://t.co/cVGUCBjGTP

REMINDER: My district offices are holding an American flag recycling drive. Just as there's etiquette for displaying your flag, there's also etiquette for disposing of flags. If you bring your American flag to one of my offices listed below, we will properly dispose of it in a respectful manner.

The One Big Beautiful Bill codifies 28 of President Trump’s executive actions, turning his strong leadership into lasting law! This is a big win for American families, small businesses, and the future of our great nation! https://t.co/qdbNyIIoLL

On this Independence Day, let’s celebrate the freedoms that make America the greatest nation on earth. Grateful for our founding fathers’ vision and for the brave men and women who defend our liberty every day. May God continue to bless the USA and the people of NC-07! https://t.co/hZfjJ3frDs

What a great way to kick off the Fourth of July weekend! The One Big Beautiful Bill passed the House and is on its way to President Trump’s desk! 

This historic legislation delivers big wins to not just the fine citizens who live in North Carolina's Seventh Congressional District, but to Americans across the country. The bill prevents the largest tax hike in history by making permanent key tax cuts that will incentivize the investment and growth necessary to stimulate the economy and increase wages. It also secures our borders, strengthens our national defense, cuts waste, fraud, and abuse across the board, and supports American workers by excluding tips and overtime pay from being taxed, as well as providing tax rebates for seniors.

Great news for NC’s specialty crop growers— @SecRollins and @USDA have released $1.3 billion in Marketing Assistance for Specialty Crop (MASC) funds. This support is critical for our growers navigating ongoing economic challenges.

During a recent House Ag Committee Hearing, I brought up the importance of the MASC program to North Carolina as one of the nation’s most diverse agricultural states and personally asked the Secretary for an update on its rollout. Thank you, Secretary Rollins for helping NC growers!

This month, I had the privilege of meeting with the North Carolina Home Builders Association in D.C. to discuss how Congress can help eliminate the red tape which delays project completion among other topics. As a member of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, reducing these inefficiencies is one of my top priorities!
This week, I met with the National Association of Manufacturers to discuss the importance of getting the One Big Beautiful Bill done to catalyze the economy! https://t.co/McdmjgYSOf

For NC-07’s grain growers and livestock producers, a well-functioning and modern grain standards and inspection system is critical. The House Ag Committee is working to modernize this system through Reauthorization of the US Grain Standards Act to deliver a more efficient and technology-forward system. Listen to my questioning at the hearing below.

NC pork producers have a friend at USDA in Secretary Brooke Rollins. Grateful for her pushing back against Prop 12. Secretary Rollins is right, California has the right to do what California wants to do, but NC-07 farm families feed the nation, and they deserve fair, science-based regulations, not California mandates.

Today, the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee advanced the Promoting Efficient Review for Modern Infrastructure Today (PERMIT) Act, a key permitting reform package aimed at cutting red tape, streamlining review processes, and providing greater regulatory clarity under the Clean Water Act.

I'm proud to have introduced three of the bills included in the PERMIT Act. You can listen to my full remarks on each of them below.

Thank you, @SBA_Kelly, for visiting NC-07 and helping spread the word on how beneficial the One Big Beautiful Bill will be for small business owners in North Carolina!

https://t.co/1V2Xmcycmq

My bill, the Maritime Supply Chain Security Act, was recently passed in the House. It strengthens port infrastructure and bolsters our national security by clarifying federal funds can be used to replace port crane hardware and software of Chinese origin. I had the opportunity to discuss its significance with Nick Craig, emphasizing how the bill will safeguard our nation and highlight the Port of Wilmington's vital role in driving North Carolina’s economic growth.

Just wrapped up a productive meeting with Chancellor Philip Rogers of East Carolina University. Proud of the work ECU is doing to strengthen eastern North Carolina through education, healthcare, and innovation. Looking forward to our continued partnership! https://t.co/JAJdJwLkSJ
Read the full article here: https://t.co/UqIHhywAYt

Last week, @SBA_Kelly and I met with several small business owners in the Wilmington area. The message is clear, the One Big Beautiful Bill isn’t just the path to their success, it’s how they will thrive!

I commend President Trump for taking decisive and resolute action to destroy Iran’s nuclear capabilities.

Regardless of any Iranian response which may occur, the President and those in our great military responsible for successfully carrying out this difficult mission have provided a meaningful opportunity for lasting peace in the Middle East and safety to the United States and our allies.

I recently joined Nick Craig on The Nick Craig Show where we covered a variety of topics— below you can listen to my thoughts on the latest on Israel vs Iran.

Listen to the full episode wherever you get your podcast. https://t.co/uB7n6QAHrv
It was a pleasure to host @SBA_Kelly in NC-07 today! We toured some incredible local businesses and met some of the most hardworking folks in the country. Thanks for visiting!
It’s time for the Senate to pass the One Big Beautiful Bill that puts American manufacturing FIRST. NC-07 workers and businesses are ready to lead! https://t.co/rUkacPC6zs
I sat down with WECT’s John Evans this morning to talk about the One Big Beautiful Bill and more! Tune in to channel 6 tonight! https://t.co/ZSYUQlw1g6
Happy Father’s Day to all the dads across NC-07! https://t.co/FcB7FyvxDO

Heartbroken by the tragic shooting in Minneapolis. I’m praying for the families and friends of Melissa and Mark Hortman and John and Yvette Hoffman. There is no place for political violence in America.
Happy Birthday to the U.S. Army! Grateful for 250 years of service, sacrifice, and strength. Here's to the soldiers who protect our freedoms and uphold our values every day!

On Flag Day, we honor the enduring symbol of our freedom, unity, and sacrifice. The American flag reminds us of the values which make our nation great — liberty, faith, and the courage of those who defend it! 🇺🇸

Israel has every right to defend itself against the Iranian regime’s escalating nuclear threat. Last night’s operation was a necessary step to protect peace and stability in the region. America stands with our ally.

✅ One Big Beautiful Bill
✅ One Big Beautiful Baseball Game

House Republicans continue to win on the floor and on the field!

It was great to welcome Liliana Arroyo Contreras of North Brunswick High School, the winner of the NC-07 Congressional Art Competition, to Capitol Hill. Her artwork, “Black and White,” will be proudly displayed in the halls of Congress for the next year! https://t.co/TGQzVJrGqL

I’ve been lucky to work for wonderful mentors throughout my career, including one of my all-time favorites, Senator Elizabeth Dole. It was a pleasure catching up with her at the Dole Senate staff reunion this past weekend. I am so grateful the state recognized and honored her this past week for her tireless commitment to public service.  No one is more deserving.

The DMV in Wilmington, along with several other offices across the state, will now be open most Saturdays this summer for walk-in customers! If you haven’t been able to get an appointment to get a REAL ID or other services, Saturday is a great opportunity!

My heart is with the victims of today’s attack in Colorado. There is no place for terrorism nor antisemitism, particularly in the United States.  Please join in praying for a full recovery for all affected.

Today, we recognize Memorial Day— a time to honor the brave men and women of the United States Armed Forces who made the ultimate sacrifice in defense of our freedoms. Their courage and commitment are the backbone of our national security, and on this Monday, we stand united in gratitude and reflection. May we never forget their sacrifice, and may we strive to live in a way that honors their memory.

Congratulations to Darryl Nirenberg, who was recently nominated by @POTUS to serve as U.S. Ambassador to Romania. 

I have been lucky to know Darryl for 30 years going back to when he was chief of staff to U.S. Senator Jesse Helms.  I know the Senator would be proud of Darryl and excited about his opportunity to carry out President Trump’s America First agenda, which he will do ably with a steady hand. Congratulations Darryl!

This morning, my Republican colleagues and I passed President Trump’s One Big Beautiful Bill. This monumental legislation is a win for hardworking families in North Carolina and across the nation— the Senate needs to act NOW. https://t.co/VuvEc92jR3

My thoughts and prayers are with all Israelis, especially the family and loved ones of Yaron Lischinsky and Sarah Milgrim, Israeli Embassy staffers who were murdered last night in Washington, DC. This blatant act of antisemitism has no place on American soil.

The One Big Beautiful Bill protects NC-07’s 550,300 taxpayers from the largest tax hike in history. This bill delivers real relief for working families, farmers, and small businesses!

Source: https://t.co/QdadFSjkR3 https://t.co/YQQI5N9O98
Thinking of President Biden and his family following the news of his cancer diagnosis. Wishing him strength and a full recovery.

I enjoyed my time at the 2025 Celebration of Construction on the National Mall event today. It is an outstanding showcase of American engineering, innovation, and workforce talent! As Chair of the Highways & Transit Subcommittee, it’s great to see how the industry is building a stronger America!

As we continue to celebrate National Police Week, I want to thank to Officer Caitlin Hutchins (Carolina Beach PD), Detective Jameson Hutchins (Wilmington PD), Sergeant Rebecca Allen, and Captain Jeff Beck (Brunswick County Sheriff’s Office) for their unwavering service to Southeastern North Carolina. Your dedication keeps our communities safe, and we are truly grateful!

May is Military Appreciation Month — a time to recognize the heroic men and women who serve our nation. I'm especially proud of the dedicated service members in NC-07! Thank you for your sacrifice. https://t.co/C05O30TsJH

This week we celebrate National Police Week— honoring the brave men and women who serve and protect our communities! I would like to give a special thank you to the dedicated officers in North Carolina's 7th Congressional District. Your commitment, courage, and sacrifice keep our neighborhoods safe!
This morning, Congress passed a bill to codify President Trump’s Executive Order renaming the Gulf of Mexico to the Gulf of America! https://t.co/Kgn7LLuPHP
As a member of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, I always enjoy discussions with the industry’s professionals— thanks for making the trip to Washington!
Today we honor Victory Day — marking the end of WWII in Europe 80 years ago. A salute to the courage, sacrifice, and unity that brought peace! https://t.co/b9l1KrXHMb

Just wrapped up a productive meeting with Fayetteville State University! Excited to work together on initiatives that will enhance educational opportunities and strengthen our community. The future is bright for FSU! https://t.co/KIzXeMpgKl

A great turnout for the 2025 North Carolina Economic Development Summit! A big thank you to everyone who joined us to hear the delegation share the latest updates from Congress! https://t.co/EaPF9TNHlC

Happy National Nurses Day to the heroes in scrubs! Your compassion, strength, and dedication make the world a healthier, kinder place.
Thank you for all that you do—today and every day! https://t.co/5ldv1SArGx
Happy Teacher Appreciation Day! To the educators who inspire minds, spark curiosity, and shape the future—thank you for your endless dedication and tireless work! https://t.co/bBoZRQBb3J
It is Small Business Week! One of my favorite small businesses in NC-07 is Leinwand’s of Elizabethtown. The department store has been a staple of Elizabethtown since 1935! https://t.co/BTWHe6VIjR

It was a pleasure to welcome the Topsail Island Shoreline Protection Commission to my office this week. We had a productive discussion about strengthening FEMA disaster recovery coordination. Grateful for their dedication—and for making the trip to Washington! https://t.co/G3X6iIbMVK

Today @TransportGOP is marking up our budget reconciliation proposal; which will save taxpayers over $10B, provide funding for @USCG, and modernize air traffic control systems. Plus, we’ll make sure everyone who drives on our roads – including electric vehicles – pay their fair share.

President Trump is ushering in a new Golden Age of America!

✅ Restarted construction of the southern border wall
✅ Created 345,000 jobs
✅ Unlocked America's Energy potential – bringing gas prices down 6.3%
✅ Reversed Biden-era rules – saving the average family of four $11,000
✅ Ended DEI in the military and government

The Winston-Salem VA Regional Office is hosting free events in Whiteville and Wilmington for veterans and their families. Whether you're looking to file a VA claim, check the status of an existing one, or appeal a decision, this is your chance to speak directly with a VA service officer. In some cases, you may even receive an on-the-spot decision. Don’t miss this valuable opportunity for one-on-one support with your VA benefits.

For all veterans attending, please bring your medical records both military and civilian along with your DD Form 214 and marriage licenses.

Wishing you and your loved ones a blessed Easter!
 
Luke 24:6: “He is not here; he has risen!” https://t.co/FtNjBIWZPR

It’s National Lineman Appreciation Day! I recently introduced H.Res.337, a bill recognizing April 18, 2025, as National Lineman Appreciation Day and commends the men and women who work tirelessly to keep our lights on! You can read more about the resolution here https://t.co/wMbxRFdvNC.

Had a great conversation with the National Beer Wholesalers Association Next Generation Group this week! With more than 4,000 beer distributors across North Carolina, I'm proud to support their efforts in Washington! https://t.co/zjTyLDTYT2
Great to meet with the NC State agribusiness management class in Washington! Excited to see the difference these bright students make in the future. Go Pack! https://t.co/c42g1qyNXl

A very productive Highways and Transit Subcommittee hearing this morning. We talked about the important role of trucking in moving goods and the challenges truckers face, such as worker shortages, regulations, and rising costs. As we work on the transportation bill, we'll look for ways to support truckers, improve disaster response, and boost local economies. Thanks to the witnesses for sharing their insights with the committee.

Great to visit the Brunswick Nuclear Plant on Monday! North Carolina ranks among the top five states in nuclear power production, playing a key role in generating clean, safe, and reliable American-made energy. Thanks to those who took the time to give me a tour of the facility! https://t.co/L4hOyL8vgJ

Hamas had the opportunity to end the war months ago by surrendering and releasing the hostages, but chose not to. While Israel accepted two ceasefire agreements brokered by the United States, Hamas rejected them. The U.S. must ensure Israel has the support and resources necessary to defend their citizens.

Happy National Ag Day! Today, we celebrate the hardworking farmers, ranchers, and producers who feed our nation and fuel our economy. Agriculture supports 1,524,239 jobs across NC and 115,000 in NC-07! I’m committed to advocating for policies that empower our agricultural industry and ensure our farmers continue to thrive!

Proud to see my former colleague from the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, Lori Chavez-DeRemer, confirmed as Secretary of Labor. Having worked with her firsthand, I have no doubt she will be a great asset to the Trump Administration!
Congratulations Seahawks! Good luck in the NCAA tournament!

After listening to President Trump’s speech, I remain hopeful he, along with Congress, can work together to accomplish meaningful change for the American people. The next four years offer the chance for collaboration on key issues such as economic growth, national security, and restoring American greatness. I believe with a shared commitment to the well-being of our nation, we can find common ground, overcome obstacles, and create a brighter future for all Americans.
President Trump is following through on promises made. He can’t accomplish everything overnight, but he’s on the right path to renew the American Dream.

It’s great to have New Hanover County Sheriff McMahon in Washington for President Trump’s Joint Address! We both agree, safety and security in North Carolina is the top priority! https://t.co/KQToFxwJ8B

It’s my privilege to welcome New Hanover County Sheriff Ed McMahon to the Joint Session for the State of the Union Address tonight. I have known and worked with the Sheriff for a number of years. National security and public safety is the number one responsibility of government at all levels, and I appreciate the Sheriff’s commitment to ensuring the safety of our citizens and communities.
Always an honor to preside over the House Floor! https://t.co/qziz7gPvjF

It was a pleasure meeting with the team from Fayetteville Technical Community College in DC. FTCC is fortunate to have such dedicated leaders! I’m excited to continue collaborating moving forward. https://t.co/K3mBKNWFVD

Pleased to see Kash Patel confirmed as the new Director of the FBI. His dedication to transparency, accountability, and fairly enforcing our laws will help restore the American people’s trust in their government.

Congratulations to Kelly Loeffler on being named Administrator of the Small Business Administration. Her leadership will make a positive impact on the growth and success of small businesses across the country!
Recently, North Carolina National Guard members visited my DC office. I’m proud to support them and ensure they have the resources they need to continue their important work! https://t.co/qyGZfEzxBX
Great to see another Trump cabinet member confirmed. With Howard Lutnick’s extensive knowledge in business and finance, he will be an excellent Secretary of Commerce!

It’s been 500 days since Hamas launched its brutal attack on Israel. Every day that passes, more families remain torn apart. We must continue to demand the return of all hostages. https://t.co/BPcs1jqLEJ

Happy Presidents' Day! Today, we honor all the leaders who have shaped our great nation. A special thank you to President Trump for your leadership and dedication to America’s future. https://t.co/XBDlsFtZUm

Brooke Rollins will be an excellent Secretary of Agriculture. She will safeguard our nation’s food security, strengthen our export markets, and be an asset in advancing and implementing a robust Farm Bill. Secretary Rollins will protect and grow NC’s $111 billion agriculture and agribusiness sector!  I’m looking forward to working with her as I continue to serve on the Committee on Agriculture.

Great to see RFK Jr. confirmed as Secretary of HHS! For too long, our nation’s health has been put on the back burner. RFK Jr. understands a healthy America is key for a prosperous America. Looking forward to the positive changes ahead!

Congratulations to Tulsi Gabbard on being confirmed as Director of National Intelligence! With her understanding of global security and commitment to truth, she's a great choice to lead our nation's intelligence efforts.

Excited to see Russell Vought confirmed as Director of the Office of Management and Budget. His commitment to fiscal responsibility will be invaluable in steering our nation's budget toward efficiency and accountability.

Scott Turner’s background in urban development, combined with his understanding of community needs, makes him an excellent choice for Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. His focus on sustainable growth and innovative housing solutions will help President Trump tackle some of the major issues we’re seeing in housing and growing better, safer communities.

It was a pleasure meeting with Joey Hopkins, Secretary of the North Carolina Department of Transportation. I look forward to working together for North Carolina on Helene recovery and reauthorizing our nation’s surface transportation systems. https://t.co/ymOGDbGr3A
Thank you for the introduction and kind words Chairman Babin. Excited to get to work on the Science, Space, and Technology Committee! https://t.co/JlLiLjs9hq

Pam Bondi proved during her confirmation hearing she is capable and qualified to serve and succeed as Attorney General. Her extensive legal experience, including her tenure as Florida's Attorney General, demonstrates her ability to effectively handle legal issues at the state and national level.

With Doug Collins’ background in both the military and Congress, he is an ideal choice to serve as the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. When I served with him in the House, he consistently supported legislation to reform government agencies, focusing on improving efficiency and accountability. His background in addressing the challenges within the VA will ensure better outcomes for those who have served our country.

Chris Wright’s experience and vision for a sustainable, secure energy future will be invaluable as we transition to cleaner, more resilient energy systems. He’s a great choice for tackling the challenges ahead as Secretary of Energy.

Congratulations to Governor Doug Burgum on his confirmation as Secretary of Interior. He is an exceptional choice and a proven leader committed to protecting the environment while developing clean, strong, American-made energy just like he did as Governor of North Dakota. He is the perfect person to carry out the mission of the Department of Interior and implement President Trump’s agenda.

It was great to serve alongside Lee Zeldin for several years in the House. With his experience in government and commitment to balancing environmental protection with economic growth, he is an ideal choice to serve as EPA Administrator. He understands the need to move away from the far-left Green New Deal and prioritize the expansion of clean, American-made energy.
My heart goes out to everyone affected and to the first responders. This is truly heartbreaking. Praying for all involved.
Thank you, President Trump, for signing the Laken Riley Act into law! Grateful for his leadership and commitment to justice!

I am thrilled to see Sean Duffy confirmed as our next Secretary of Transportation! His strong leadership and commitment to ushering in a Golden Age of Transportation is exactly what we need to bolster our economy and supply chain, lead on large, proven infrastructure projects connecting all corners of America, and prioritize safety in the movement of our goods and people. I had the honor to serve with him in the House, and as Congress crafts legislation reauthorizing our surface transportation programs, I look forward to continue working with him again as chairman of the Subcommittee on Highways and Transit.

The last four years under President Biden’s leadership have been tough on American families. Energy, food, and housing costs have skyrocketed. Under the leadership of President Trump, and Scott Bessent who he chose to lead the Department of Treasury, I know we can return to an economic golden age. His expertise in global markets and financial strategy make him a great choice to help bring back the strong economy we saw during President Trump’s first term.

On Holocaust Remembrance Day, we honor the victims of unimaginable hatred and reflect on the importance of standing against all forms of oppression. Having served with Kristi Noem in the House of Representatives, I know how much she cares about the security of all Americans.
